analyzed: de la bla ma dam pa ma yin pa bsten pa ni bdag nyid nyams par byed pas de'i skyon bstan pa ni /
translated: Relying on a non-genuine sublime guru causes one's own degeneration, so the faults of that are taught:

original: dug sprul zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: dug sprul zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: The poisonous snake, and so on.

original: dper na so ga'i tshad pas nyen pas dug sprul la grib mar 'khrul te drung du phyin na bdag nyid gsod par byed pa bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na so ga'i tshad pas nyen pas dug sprul la grib mar 'khrul te drung du phyin na bdag nyid gsod par byed pa bzhin du //
translated: For example, a person afflicted with a summer fever mistakes a poisonous snake for a shadow and approaches it, and it kills him.

original: bla ma ngan pa rnams la bla mar 'du shes nas ste gal gyis nyen nas de'i drung du phyin na /
analyzed: bla ma ngan pa rnams la bla mar 'du shes nas ste gal gyis nyen nas de'i drung du phyin na /
translated: Likewise, if you approach a bad teacher, thinking he is a good teacher, because of your great need,

original: de bsten pas de'i skyon lta ba ngan pa dang / spyod pa ngan pa 'go bas //
analyzed: de bsten pas de'i skyon lta ba ngan pa dang / spyod pa ngan pa 'go bas //
translated: you will contract his faults, such as bad views and bad behavior.

original: de dag sprul bzhin dub ltas te spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag sprul bzhin dub ltas te spang bar bya'o //
translated: You should abandon him, seeing him as a snake.

original: sprul lta bu'i bla ma de gang yin snyam pa la //🔽de nyid mi shes bram ze zhes pa nas //
analyzed: sprul lta bu'i bla ma de gang yin snyam pa la // de nyid mi shes bram ze zhes pa nas //
translated: What kind of teacher is like a snake?

original: brdzun pa nyid du gol zhes pa'i bar gyis bram ze ba bstan te /🔽gyi na rig byed ces pa nas //
analyzed: brdzun pa nyid du gol zhes pa'i bar gyis bram ze ba bstan te / gyi na rig byed ces pa nas //
translated: The verse from “A brahmin who does not know reality” up to “a false teacher” describes a brahmin.

original: me la sreg gi bar ni khyim na gnas pa'o //🔽dbyu gu nas tshig gzhan gyis ni dka' thub la gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: me la sreg gi bar ni khyim na gnas pa'o // dbyu gu nas tshig gzhan gyis ni dka' thub la gnas pa bstan te /
translated: The verse from “A fool who recites the Vedas” up to “a householder” describes a householder.🔽The verse from “A person who practices austerities” up to “a renunciant” describes an ascetic.

original: dbyu gu ni brtul zhugs 'dul ba dang pos bstan pa 'ang de nyid do //
analyzed: dbyu gu ni brtul zhugs 'dul ba dang pos bstan pa 'ang de nyid do //
translated: The verse from “A person who is a master of the Vedas” up to “a person who is a master of the Vedas” describes a renunciant.

original: ae ra'i thal ba nas gzhan la ston gyi bar gyis ni dbang phyug pa bstan te go sla'o //
analyzed: ae ra'i thal ba nas gzhan la ston gyi bar gyis ni dbang phyug pa bstan te go sla'o //
translated: The passage from “the ashes of E” up to “the teacher” indicates the followers of Iśvara.

original: @265b sen mo ring zhing nas thar pa nam yang yod ma yin zer ba'i bar gyis mchod 'os pa bstan te go sla'o //
analyzed: @265b sen mo ring zhing nas thar pa nam yang yod ma yin zer ba'i bar gyis mchod 'os pa bstan te go sla'o //
translated: The passage from “long nails” up to “there is never liberation” indicates the Ājīvikas.

original: lus kyi dka' thub 'ba' zhig tsam nas sangs rgyas kyi tshul 'dzin gyi bar gyi ni /🔽theg pa chung ngu la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dka' thub 'ba' zhig tsam nas sangs rgyas kyi tshul 'dzin gyi bar gyi ni / theg pa chung ngu la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The passage from “merely the austerities of the body” up to “the way of the Buddha” indicates those who have entered the Hīnayāna.

original: theg pa chen po de la rgyu byed ces nas //
analyzed: theg pa chen po de la rgyu byed ces nas //
translated: The passage from “the Mahāyāna” up to “the cause” indicates those who have entered the cause vehicle.

original: tshad ma'i bstan bcos yin gyis ni rgyu'i theg pa la zhugs par bstan to //
analyzed: tshad ma'i bstan bcos yin gyis ni rgyu'i theg pa la zhugs par bstan to //
translated: The passage from “the treatise on logic” up to “the cause vehicle” indicates those who have entered the cause vehicle.

original: kha cig dkyil 'khor 'khor lo ma lus bsgom ni 'bras bu'i theg pa la zhugs pa rtog pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: kha cig dkyil 'khor 'khor lo ma lus bsgom ni 'bras bu'i theg pa la zhugs pa rtog pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa bstan to //
translated: The passage from “some meditate on the entire maṇḍala wheel” up to “the result vehicle” indicates those who have entered the result vehicle and abide in the yoga of imagination.

original: nam mkha'i khams la rtogs par nang ba ni phyi rol pa dang yang dag thun mong ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la rtogs par nang ba ni phyi rol pa dang yang dag thun mong ba ste /
translated: The passage from “the realization in the element of space” up to “the outsiders” indicates the commonality with the perfect [Buddhists].

original: nam mkha' la lta ba dang / dus la lta ba dang / phyogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la lta ba dang / dus la lta ba dang / phyogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The views of space, time, and direction.

original: de la dang po ni nam mkha'i sprin med pa la glo bur du byung bas de mi rtag par lta ba dang / dus kyi 'gyur bas mi rtag par lta ba dang / phyogs ni nyi ma shar nub kyis mi rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni nam mkha'i sprin med pa la glo bur du byung bas de mi rtag par lta ba dang / dus kyi 'gyur bas mi rtag par lta ba dang / phyogs ni nyi ma shar nub kyis mi rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: The first of these is the view that the sky is impermanent because clouds arise in it and then disappear; the second is the view that the sky is impermanent because of the changes of the seasons; and the third is the view that the sky is impermanent because the sun rises and sets in it.

original: bzhi ba'i don 'chad pa ni bzhi pa gsum pa'i don du go nas sangs rgyas pa'i bde ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi ba'i don 'chad pa ni bzhi pa gsum pa'i don du go nas sangs rgyas pa'i bde ba la brten pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the fourth is understood as the meaning of the third, and is the reliance on the bliss of the Buddhists.

original: de dag las kha cig ni de kho na nyid dang bral pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las kha cig ni de kho na nyid dang bral pa'o //
translated: Some of them are devoid of reality.

original: kha cig de nyid ma nor ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig de nyid ma nor ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Some are devoid of the nonerroneous reality.

original: de ltar bla ma dam pa ma yin pa de dag shes nas spangs la ;
analyzed: de ltar bla ma dam pa ma yin pa de dag shes nas spangs la ;
translated: Having understood those to be non-genuine gurus, one should abandon them.

original: / de dag las bzlog pa'i bla ma'i de kho na nyid ma nor ba la zhugs shing de ston par nus pa rnams bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: / de dag las bzlog pa'i bla ma'i de kho na nyid ma nor ba la zhugs shing de ston par nus pa rnams bsten par bya'o //
translated: One should rely on those gurus who are the opposite of them, who are engaged in the nonerroneous reality and are able to teach it.

original: de nas de kho na nyid kyi don btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de kho na nyid kyi don btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should seek the meaning of reality.

original: de la dang por de kho na nyid ma yin pa shes par bya ba'i phyir de'i mi mthun pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan kun shes nas spang bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dang por de kho na nyid ma yin pa shes par bya ba'i phyir de'i mi mthun pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan kun shes nas spang bar bya ba ni /
translated: In order to understand that which is not reality, one should abandon the incompatible, which is the meditative stabilization with an object that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gang zhig gang la zhes pa la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la zhes pa la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is taught by “Whoever, whatever…”

original: de la gang zhig ni gang zag go //
analyzed: de la gang zhig ni gang zag go //
translated: In this verse, “whoever” is the person.

original: gang la ni yi dam gyi lha lta bu de la'o //
analyzed: gang la ni yi dam gyi lha lta bu de la'o //
translated: “Whatever” is the deity, such as the pledged deity.

original: mos par gyur pa ni des bdag grol bar byed do zhes lhag par dad pa'o //
analyzed: mos par gyur pa ni des bdag grol bar byed do zhes lhag par dad pa'o //
translated: “Having faith” is having the strong faith that “he will liberate me.”

original: bsam gtan gnas pa ni de la bskyed rim gyi sgo nas bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnas pa ni de la bskyed rim gyi sgo nas bsgom pa'o //
translated: “Meditative stabilization” is the cultivation by way of the creation stage.

original: thar pa mi thob pa ni /
analyzed: thar pa mi thob pa ni /
translated: “Not attaining liberation”

original: sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: means not becoming a buddha.

original: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
analyzed: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
translated: The Śrī Hevajra Tantra says:

original: lha med sngags kyi yod ma yin //
analyzed: lha med sngags kyi yod ma yin //

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las //

analyzed: @266a * // bdag gir mi 'dzin ngar mi 'dzin // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Not grasping as mine, not grasping as “I.”

analyzed: mar me ci dgos lha bshos de la dgos //
translated: What is the use of a butter lamp? What is the use of a bali offering?

analyzed: de la ci bya gsang sngags brten pa de ci dgos //

original: zhes gsungs pas so //

translated: It is not merely the separation from suffering,

translated: but it is the bliss of nonobservation.🔽In the Cakrasaṃvara Tantra,

translated: it states:

translated: is not even a sixteenth part🔽of the vajra holder’s bliss.🔽And in this very tantra,

translated: it states:

translated: Since it is necessary to cultivate a path that is in accord with the result,

translated: that itself is the unfabricated deity.🔽The teaching that everything is the ultimate heart-essence is “O my dear!

analyzed: thams cad don gyi snying por ston pa ni kye lags gang smras zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Whatever is said . . .”

analyzed: kye lags ni bod pa'o //

analyzed: gang smras ni @266b bla ma dam pa ma yin pa rnams kyi gong du ston pa'o //

original: brdzun pa ni don med do //
analyzed: brdzun pa ni don med do //

translated: Wrong means not representing the innate.

original: gang la zhen pa yod pa de yang thong //
analyzed: gang la zhen pa yod pa de yang thong //
translated: Also, abandon that which is clung to.

analyzed: zhes pa ni yi dam gyi lha yin zhes 'dzin pa de thong zhes pa'o //
translated: That is, abandon the thought “This is the pledged deity.”

original: rtog par gyur na thams cad de yin te //
analyzed: rtog par gyur na thams cad de yin te //
translated: If it is conceptualized, everything is that.

original: zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa de rtogs nas brtan g-yo thams cad de yin te zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa de rtogs nas brtan g-yo thams cad de yin te zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig yin pa'o //
translated: If that connate [nature] is realized, everything—the inanimate world and animate beings—is that.

original: de las gzhan gyis sus kyang shes mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyis sus kyang shes mi 'gyur //

original: zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa las gzhan log nas lha gang gis kyang mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa las gzhan log nas lha gang gis kyang mi shes pa'o //

original: 'o na gzhan thams cad spang ngam snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan thams cad spang ngam snyam pa la /
translated: Now, if one thinks that all others are to be abandoned,

analyzed: klog pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de ye nas kun la gnas pas rtogs na thams cad de rang las ma 'das pa'o //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [The reply is] as stated in the verse beginning with there is no view that does not illustrate it.

original: de ni lhan cig skyes so //
analyzed: de ni lhan cig skyes so //
translated: That is simultaneously born.

analyzed: mi mtshon pa ni mi mtshon pa'i lta ba grub mtha' gang yang med de /
translated: Not illustrating means that there is no philosophical position that does not illustrate it.

analyzed: kun nas ston kyang bla mas mtshon na mi rtog ste /

analyzed: de dag ni mtha' drug gis rgyas btab pas so //
translated: Those [views] are sealed by the six limits.

original: bla ma'i man ngag gis ji ltar mtshon na /

original: lag gi nor 'dra bar mngon sum du gsal por mthong ste /
analyzed: lag gi nor 'dra bar mngon sum du gsal por mthong ste /

analyzed: bla ma yis ni man ngag gang gis de mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i thabs ston gyi /

analyzed: de ni bla ma'i zhal las shes so //

original: bla ma'i zhal las thob pa de'i tshe yid 'ching ste /
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal las thob pa de'i tshe yid 'ching ste /

original: mi rtogs pas so //

original: rlung de ngas pa de dbu mar thim pa'o //
analyzed: rlung de ngas pa de dbu mar thim pa'o //

original: gar shes pa ste thabs shes pa'o //
analyzed: gar shes pa ste thabs shes pa'o //

original: lhan skyes de la 'khrul pa gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan skyes de la 'khrul pa gsal ba'i phyir /

original: sa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: de las gsum ni snang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de las gsum ni snang ba gsum mo //

original: 'di la zhes pa ni 'dir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes pa ni 'dir zhes pa'o //

original: yan lag thams cad ni 'khor 'das so //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad ni 'khor 'das so //
translated: All the limbs are samsara and nirvana.

original: gnas ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: gnas ni gzhi'o //
translated: The place is the basis.

original: de ltar snang ba gsum po de ni rmongs pa'i rgyu yin pas bzhag la /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba gsum po de ni rmongs pa'i rgyu yin pas bzhag la /
translated: As such, since those three appearances are the cause of delusion, they are posited.

original: snang ba gsum dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa 'khor ba yin pas spangs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi snang ba stobs yin te //
analyzed: snang ba gsum dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rnam pa 'khor ba yin pas spangs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi snang ba stobs yin te //
translated: Since the aspect of mind endowed with the three appearances is samsara, it is to be abandoned, and the appearance of the Buddha is power.

analyzed: da ltar mi thob pas de gnyis dbang po'i rim pas mtshams te rnal 'byor pas 'od gsal bsgoms zhes pa'o //
translated: Since one does not attain that now, those two are distinguished by the stages of the faculties.

original: mtshams ni bzhi 'od gsal gyi bdag nyid yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams ni bzhi 'od gsal gyi bdag nyid yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The “distinction” is the recognition of the nature of luminosity.

original: 'od gsal de'i gti mug ste /
analyzed: 'od gsal de'i gti mug ste /
translated: That luminosity is ignorance,

original: mi shes pa'i mtsho chad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mtsho chad par byed pa'o //
translated: which is the “lake” of non-knowing that is “cut off.”

original: gal te 'od gsal gang yin ba de shes na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'od gsal gang yin ba de shes na'o //
translated: If one knows what luminosity is,🔽then one experiences the knowledge of the potential of sentient beings, which is realization.

original: des ni sems can gyis rigs pa'i shes pa myong ba ni rtogs pa yin pas de lhan skyes ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems can gyis rigs pa'i shes pa myong ba ni rtogs pa yin pas de lhan skyes ma yin par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is not connate.

original: 'o na snang ba 'di nyid la lhan cig yin snyam pa la /🔽lan du kye ho zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na snang ba 'di nyid la lhan cig yin snyam pa la / lan du kye ho zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “ But is it connate in this appearance?”🔽The reply is “Kye ma!

original: kye ho ni kye ma de ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: kye ho ni kye ma de ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: ” Kye ma!

original: 'di ni rang gis rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rang gis rig pa ste /
translated: This is self-knowing.

original: 'di la 'khrul par ma byed cig / ces pa ni snang ba 'di nyid ni gang gis gsum zhes pa snang ba dang / mched pa dang / nye bar thob pas te /
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul par ma byed cig / ces pa ni snang ba 'di nyid ni gang gis gsum zhes pa snang ba dang / mched pa dang / nye bar thob pas te /
translated: This appearance is the appearance of the three, that is, appearance, increase, and near-attainment,

original: 'khor ba rgyud mar 'gro ba rtog pa'i snang ab ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba rgyud mar 'gro ba rtog pa'i snang ab ste /
translated: which is the appearance of the conception that goes on in a continuous stream of cyclic existence.

analyzed: 'di la lhan cig skyes pa yin no zhes 'khrul par ma byed cig ces pa'o //
translated: Do not be mistaken about this, thinking that it is connate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: de dngos dang / dngos med kyi rtog pa gnyis ka 'ching ba nyid du bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pas so //
translated: Because the Sugata has said that both the conception of entity and the conception of nonentity are bonds.

original: de lta bu lam mnor ba de la blo ji ltar gzhag snyam pa la /🔽gnyug ma'i yid ni zhes @269a * //
analyzed: de lta bu lam mnor ba de la blo ji ltar gzhag snyam pa la / gnyug ma'i yid ni zhes @269a * //
translated: How should the mind be placed in that nonerroneous path?

original: pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The intrinsic mind, etc.

original: gnyug ma'i yid ni lhan skyes so //
analyzed: gnyug ma'i yid ni lhan skyes so //
translated: The intrinsic mind is the connate.

original: gcig tu stong dang zhes pa ni //🔽bsgom bya sgom byed gnyis spangs la //
analyzed: gcig tu stong dang zhes pa ni // bsgom bya sgom byed gnyis spangs la //
translated: The single emptiness, etc.🔽is placed in the nonapprehended state,

original: mi dmigs pa la gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la gzhag pa'o //
translated: having abandoned the two, the object of meditation and the meditator.

original: dpe ji ltar bzhag na chu la chu gzhag bzhin du ste /
analyzed: dpe ji ltar bzhag na chu la chu gzhag bzhin du ste /
translated: How is it placed as an example? Like water placed in water.

original: chu rgyu 'od gsal stong pa la //
analyzed: chu rgyu 'od gsal stong pa la //
translated: The water element is luminosity-emptiness.

original: chu bzhag ste mi rtog par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: chu bzhag ste mi rtog par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Having placed the water, rest without conceptuality.

original: bcos ma'i rnal 'byor gyis mi grol bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcos ma'i rnal 'byor gyis mi grol bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the contrived yogas do not liberate,

original: bsam gtan brdzun pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan brdzun pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “False meditative concentration,” and so on.

original: bsam gtan brdzun pa ni rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan brdzun pa ni rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: False meditative concentration is the yoga of thoughts.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba ni las kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba ni las kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The net of magic is the karmamudra.

original: ji ltar pang du 'khyud de ma 'khyud par spongs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar pang du 'khyud de ma 'khyud par spongs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: How does one embrace in one’s lap? Abandon not embracing.

original: de nyid spangs pa'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid spangs pa'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the logic of abandoning that,

original: bla ma dam pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “The words of the sublime guru,” and so on.

original: bla ma dam pa'i bka' yis bden par yid ches pa //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i bka' yis bden par yid ches pa //
translated: One should have confidence in the truth of the words of the sublime guru.

original: de yis ni sa ra ha yis so //
analyzed: de yis ni sa ra ha yis so //
translated: That is the meaning of “the words of the sublime guru.”

original: brjod du yod pa min zhes mda' bsnun smra //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: brjod du yod pa min zhes mda' bsnun smra // zhes pa la /
translated: “It is inexpressible,” says the one with the arrow.

original: sgra dang yi ge'i yul ma yin pas na //
analyzed: sgra dang yi ge'i yul ma yin pas na //
translated: Since it is not an object of words and syllables,

original: yul ji lta bu la bzhag snyam pa la /
analyzed: yul ji lta bu la bzhag snyam pa la /
translated: one might wonder, “What kind of object is it?”

original: gdod nas dag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gdod nas dag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said, “Primordially pure,” and so on.

original: gdod nas dag pa'i nam mkha' ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha'o //
analyzed: gdod nas dag pa'i nam mkha' ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha'o //
translated: The primordially pure sky is the sky free of clouds.

original: bltas shing bltas shing mthong ba dgag par 'gyur //
analyzed: bltas shing bltas shing mthong ba dgag par 'gyur //
translated: Looking and looking, seeing will cease.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the following lines:🔽“When one looks with an inflated gaze, seeing will cease.”

original: khengs pa'i lta stangs kyis bltas na mthong ba 'gag pa ni gzung 'dzin gyis 'brel pa chad pa'o //
analyzed: khengs pa'i lta stangs kyis bltas na mthong ba 'gag pa ni gzung 'dzin gyis 'brel pa chad pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the following lines:

original: de lta bu yi dus su 'gog byed ci //
analyzed: de lta bu yi dus su 'gog byed ci //
translated: “At that time, what is there to block?”

original: zhes pa'i rlung bzhi rim gyis 'gag pa'o //🔽de yang dang po sangs rgyas kyis rgyud las //🔽nam mkha'i sprin bral ba ni khengs pa'i lta bas blta //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rlung bzhi rim gyis 'gag pa'o // de yang dang po sangs rgyas kyis rgyud las // nam mkha'i sprin bral ba ni khengs pa'i lta bas blta //
translated: This is the meaning of the following lines:

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: “The sky free of clouds is looked at with an inflated gaze.”

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: nyin par bla gab med par 'dug ste /
analyzed: nyin par bla gab med par 'dug ste /
translated: During the day, one should sit in the open air.

original: sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la khengs pa'i lta bas blta zhing /
analyzed: sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la khengs pa'i lta bas blta zhing /
translated: Looking at the cloudless sky with an inflated gaze,

original: yid mi rtog pa la bzhag na rlung rim gyis 'gags nas rtags 'char ba'o//
analyzed: yid mi rtog pa la bzhag na rlung rim gyis 'gags nas rtags 'char ba'o//
translated: one should rest the mind without thoughts.

original: 'di ni gdams ngag dam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gdams ngag dam pa ste /
translated: This is the sublime instruction.

original: gsal bar bla ma'i zhal las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gsal bar bla ma'i zhal las shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood clearly from the guru’s instructions.

original: de lta bu lhan cig skyes pa de rang la gnas na mi rtog pa'i rgyu ci yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: de lta bu lhan cig skyes pa de rang la gnas na mi rtog pa'i rgyu ci yin snyam pa la /
translated: If such a coemergence exists in oneself, why is it not realized?

original: gnyug ma'i yid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnyug ma'i yid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The so-called innate mind and so on.

original: gnyug ma'i yid ni lhan skyes ma bcos pa'o //
analyzed: gnyug ma'i yid ni lhan skyes ma bcos pa'o //
translated: The innate mind is the unfabricated coemergence.

original: @269b nga rgyal skyon ni nga dang ngar 'dzin pa'i skyon gyis bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: @269b nga rgyal skyon ni nga dang ngar 'dzin pa'i skyon gyis bsgribs pa'o //
translated: The fault of pride is obscured by the fault of “I” and grasping “mine.”

original: gzhan gyi skyon gyis mi rtogs par ston to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi skyon gyis mi rtogs par ston to //
translated: It is taught that it is not realized due to the faults of others.

original: 'jig rten ma lus bsam gtan gyis rmongs te //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma lus bsam gtan gyis rmongs te //
translated: The entire world is confused by concentration.🔽The yoga of concepts is taught by the faults of the teacher with signs.

original: zhes pa la rtog pa'i rnal 'byor mtshan bcas ston pa'i bla ma'i skyon gyis mi rtog pa dang / gzhan yang stong pa nyid rtog par ston pas kyang mi rtogs te /

analyzed: lhan skyes de skye 'gags rnams kyis brtags na de'i rang bzhin mi shes so //
translated: If that coemergence is examined with birth and cessation, its nature is not known.🔽What arises from the realization of that coemergence?

analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de rtogs pa las ci 'byung snyam pa la de'i phyir don gyi lhan skyes rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: For the sake of teaching the result of the pure meaning of coemergence, it is said, “The result of the pure meaning of coemergence is the dharmakāya.”

original: rtsa ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtsa ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root, etc.

original: de la rtsa ba dang bral ba ni /🔽rgyus ma skyes /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba dang bral ba ni / rgyus ma skyes /
translated: There, free from a root means🔽 not produced by a cause.

original: rkyen gyis mi 'gags /
analyzed: rkyen gyis mi 'gags /
translated: Not blocked by conditions.

original: ngo bo gang la yang mi rten pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo gang la yang mi rten pas so //
translated: Not dependent on any essence.

original: de nyid mi 'gyur ba ste lhan skyes so //
analyzed: de nyid mi 'gyur ba ste lhan skyes so //
translated: That itself is unchanging, i.e., innate.

original: gang sems dpa' ni lhan skyes gang yin pa de bsgoms na /
analyzed: gang sems dpa' ni lhan skyes gang yin pa de bsgoms na /
translated: The hero, i.e., the innate, when that is meditated,

analyzed: 'khor ba'i rang bzhin ni sems nyid kyi rnam rtog tsam yin pas /
translated: the nature of cyclic existence is just the thought of the mind itself,

analyzed: sems mtshon pa'i bla ma'i gdams ngag des chog pas gzhan gyis ci bya zhes pa'o //
translated: so what is the use of anything else, since the guru's instruction that illustrates the mind is sufficient?

original: lhan skyes de gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: lhan skyes de gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: If that innate is not to be expressed by anything at all,🔽 how is it illustrated by the guru?

analyzed: bla mas ji ltar mtshon snyam pa la de'i phyir rang bzhin gnyug ma brjod bya ma yin te /
translated: For that reason, The intrinsic nature, the innate, is not an object of expression,

analyzed: slob dpon man ngag mig gis mthong bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: the master sees it with the eye of esoteric instruction.

original: de'i don ni brjod bya ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de'i don ni brjod bya ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Although it is not an object of expression,

analyzed: thabs bstan pas dang po dbang po'i mngon sum gyis sgyu ma lta bu'i lus mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By the teaching of the method, first, the illusory body is seen by the direct perception of the sense organ.

analyzed: dper na mun khung gi rdzas brjod pas mi mthong ba'i thabs mar me ston pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the teaching of the method of the lamp in order to see the substance in the darkness.

original: dpes ni 'bras bu'i lhan skyes mngon sum du gyur par bstan te /
analyzed: dpes ni 'bras bu'i lhan skyes mngon sum du gyur par bstan te /
translated: The example teaches the actual clear light.

original: de nyid nyes pa dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid nyes pa dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that it is free from faults,

analyzed: chos dang chos min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “dharma and non-dharma,” and so on.

original: de la chos ni dge ba'i chos dang / chos min ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la chos ni dge ba'i chos dang / chos min ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: Therein, dharma is virtuous phenomena, and non-dharma is nonvirtuous.

original: mnyes par ni khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: mnyes par ni khyad par med pa'o //
translated: Pleasing is without distinction.

original: zos pa ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: zos pa ni rtog pa'o //
translated: Eating is conceptualization.

original: de ltar de ni las rgyu 'bras dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar de ni las rgyu 'bras dang bral ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is free from the cause and effect of karma.

original: yang de la sangs rgyas kyi yon tan 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de la sangs rgyas kyi yon tan 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the qualities of a buddha arise in that,

original: gnyug ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnyug ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “the innate mind,” and so on.

original: gnyug ma'i yid ni @270a * //
analyzed: gnyug ma'i yid ni @270a * //
translated: The innate mind

original: lhan skyes so //
analyzed: lhan skyes so //
translated: is the connate.

original: sbyangs pa ni rtog pa'i rlung dag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa ni rtog pa'i rlung dag par byas pa'o //
translated: Purified is the purification of the conceptual vāyu.

original: bla ma'i yon tan snying la 'jug pa na //
analyzed: bla ma'i yon tan snying la 'jug pa na //
translated: When the qualities of the guru enter one's heart,

analyzed: gong ma mchog gi yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rang la 'char ba'o //
translated: the qualities of the higher, supreme state, such as the powers and the forms of fearlessness, arise in oneself.

analyzed: sngags dang rgyud rnams gcig kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: I have not seen even one mantra or tantra.

analyzed: zhes pa ni ma mthong mod don rtogs pas chog ces pa'o //
translated: This means that although one has not seen them, it is sufficient to realize the meaning.

original: de lhan cig skyes pa de mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: de lhan cig skyes pa de mdor bstan nas /
translated: Having briefly explained that innate nature,

original: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain that suchness extensively,

original: 'gro ba rnams las kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams las kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, All migrating beings are individually bound by karma.

original: de la 'gro rnams thams cad las kyis so sor bcings gyur te //
analyzed: de la 'gro rnams thams cad las kyis so sor bcings gyur te //
translated: With regard to that, all migrating beings are individually bound by karma.

original: zhes pa la dge mi dge'i las ni rang gi rnam rtog tsam ste //
analyzed: zhes pa la dge mi dge'i las ni rang gi rnam rtog tsam ste //
translated: Virtuous and nonvirtuous karma are mere one's own concepts.

analyzed: des na rang gi rtog pas sprul pa yin gyis las rgyur smra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is emanated by one's own concepts, but karma is not said to be a cause.

original: de skad du yang rdo rje phreng ba las //

translated: In the Vajra Garland it is said:

original: khams gsum rlung gi sprul pa ste //

translated: The three realms are emanated by wind.

original: rmi lam rmi ba bzhin du blta //

analyzed: de dag pa'i gnas skabs la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When those [conceptualizations] cease, that state is called nirvana.

analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su shes pa na //

original: mya ngan 'das zhes de la bya //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das zhes de la bya //

original: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: bkug pa ni rtsa ba'i sems so //

translated: In order to demonstrate the faults of not realizing that innate [nature], [the text] says, If one is attached to what is pleasant, and so forth.

original: de la yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang mi 'gag pa'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: de la yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang mi 'gag pa'i dngos po la'o //
translated: There, what is pleasant refers to things that are not in opposition to the mind.

original: mnyam pa'i sems ni stong pa dang ro mnyam pa'i sems ma skyes na /
analyzed: mnyam pa'i sems ni stong pa dang ro mnyam pa'i sems ma skyes na /
translated: An equal mind refers to a mind that has not arisen as empty and of the same taste.

original: de la dngos por zhen pas sdug bsngal skyed do //
analyzed: de la dngos por zhen pas sdug bsngal skyed do //
translated: Attachment to things generates suffering.

original: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is easy to understand.

original: stong par shes pas mi 'ching ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong par shes pas mi 'ching ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one is not bound by knowing emptiness, [the text] says,

original: stong na gang yang 'dra 'am snyam pa la /
analyzed: stong na gang yang 'dra 'am snyam pa la /
translated: If it is empty, is everything the same?

original: grogs dag phag dang glang po ltos //
analyzed: grogs dag phag dang glang po ltos //
translated: Friends, look at the pig and the elephant!

original: de ltar yin te de ni ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yin te de ni ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: It is like that, but it is not that.

original: phag pa dang glang po ni phyogs 'ga' 'dra yang /
analyzed: phag pa dang glang po ni phyogs 'ga' 'dra yang /
translated: Although pigs and elephants are similar in some respects,

original: phag ni glang po ma yin no //
analyzed: phag ni glang po ma yin no //
translated: the pig is not the elephant.

original: de bzhin du stong par 'dra yang theg pa gzhan gyis brtags pa'i stong pa ni lam ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong par 'dra yang theg pa gzhan gyis brtags pa'i stong pa ni lam ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Likewise, although they are similar in being empty, the emptiness imagined by other vehicles is not the path.

original: stong pa des 'khrul pa ji ltar spong zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa des 'khrul pa ji ltar spong zhe na /
translated: How does that emptiness eliminate error?

original: ji ltar yid bzhin nor bu zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar yid bzhin nor bu zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “Just as a wish-fulfilling gem,” and so on.

original: dper na smyon ma'i lus la rin po che btags pas smyon ma'i 'khrul pa bshig nga bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na smyon ma'i lus la rin po che btags pas smyon ma'i 'khrul pa bshig nga bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the designation of a jewel on a barren woman’s body destroys the error of a barren woman,

original: stong pa'i rtog pas kyang dngos po'i 'khrul pa bshig pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i rtog pas kyang dngos po'i 'khrul pa bshig pa'o //
translated: so too, the concept of emptiness destroys the error of entities.

original: stong pa de bde ba'i gnas su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa de bde ba'i gnas su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that emptiness is the basis of bliss,

original: rang rig pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /🔽rang la rang rig bde ba chen po'i bag @277a * //
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos te / rang la rang rig bde ba chen po'i bag @277a * //
translated: it is said, “One’s own vidyā,” and so on.🔽The form of the instinct for great bliss that is self-knowing awareness

original: chags gzugs de bde ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: chags gzugs de bde ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: is the cause of bliss.

original: yang na de ma dag na bag chags te /
analyzed: yang na de ma dag na bag chags te /
translated: Moreover, if that is impure, it is an instinct;

original: ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “ignorance.”

original: de nyid dag na gzugs te stong pa'i gzugs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid dag na gzugs te stong pa'i gzugs su gyur pa'o //
translated: That itself is pure, that is, it becomes empty form.🔽What happens when one conceptualizes that?

original: de rtog pa las cir 'gyur zhen thams cad ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de rtog pa las cir 'gyur zhen thams cad ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “all,” and so on.

original: thams cad ni phyi nang ngo ;
analyzed: thams cad ni phyi nang ngo ;
translated: All refers to the external and internal.

original: / de tshe ni stong pa rtog pa de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: / de tshe ni stong pa rtog pa de'i tshe'o //
translated: At that time, that is, when one conceptualizes emptiness,

original: mkha' mnyam byed par 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' mnyam byed par 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam par mthong ba'o //
translated: one becomes like space, that is, one sees it as being the same as space.

original: stong gzugs nyams su myong ba de ni tshig gis mtshon mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong gzugs nyams su myong ba de ni tshig gis mtshon mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the experience of empty form cannot be indicated by words,

original: k'a la ku ta zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: k'a la ku ta zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “kalāpa,” and so on.

original: k'a la ku ta ni nyams su myong ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: k'a la ku ta ni nyams su myong ba'i ming ngo //
translated: Kalāpa is a name for experience.

original: smos su mi rung ba ni tshig gis mi mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: smos su mi rung ba ni tshig gis mi mtshon pa'o //
translated: It cannot be indicated means that it cannot be shown by words.

original: 'o na gang gis mtshon na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gis mtshon na /
translated: Well, then, by what is it indicated?

original: rang bzhin nam mkha' ni stong pa de rtog pa dang bral te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nam mkha' ni stong pa de rtog pa dang bral te /
translated: The nature of space is emptiness, which is free from conceptualization.

original: yid kyi 'dzin pa yin zhes pa ni des myong ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dzin pa yin zhes pa ni des myong ba'o //
translated: It is said to be the apprehension of the mind, that is, it is experienced by that.

original: 'o na yid yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yid yod dam zhe na /
translated: Well, then, does the mind exist?

original: yid de yid med byed 'gyur te //
analyzed: yid de yid med byed 'gyur te //
translated: That mind becomes mindless.

original: rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa mchog tu mdzes //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa mchog tu mdzes // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The innate nature is supremely beautiful.

original: yid de zhes pa ni dag pa'i yid do //
analyzed: yid de zhes pa ni dag pa'i yid do //
translated: The mind is the pure mind.

original: yid med byed ces pa ni ma dag pa'i yid do //
analyzed: yid med byed ces pa ni ma dag pa'i yid do //
translated: The mind-less is the impure mind.

original: dag pa'i yid de gang yin na rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa mchog tu mdzes te stong gzugs so //
analyzed: dag pa'i yid de gang yin na rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa mchog tu mdzes te stong gzugs so //
translated: The pure mind is the innate nature, supremely beautiful, which is the empty form.

original: de nyid rtogs dka' bar bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rtogs dka' bar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach that it is difficult to realize that,🔽it is said:

original: khyim dang khyim na de nyid gnas pa ste //
analyzed: khyim dang khyim na de nyid gnas pa ste //
translated: That abides in every house.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows:

original: khyim na gnas pa ni khyim mo //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni khyim mo //
translated: The house is the place of the body.

original: nags na gnas pa ni khyim min no //
analyzed: nags na gnas pa ni khyim min no //
translated: The non-house is the place of the forest.

original: de'i don brjod pa ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don brjod pa ni stong pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is emptiness.

original: bde chen gnas ni de'i rgyu stong pa ste /
analyzed: bde chen gnas ni de'i rgyu stong pa ste /
translated: The place of great bliss is the cause of that, emptiness.

original: de'i drin gyis bde ba 'char ba'o //
analyzed: de'i drin gyis bde ba 'char ba'o //
translated: Through the kindness of that, bliss arises.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyis stong par ma shes na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyis stong par ma shes na /
translated: Therefore, if they do not know that emptiness,

original: 'gro kun sems 'phrul gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro kun sems 'phrul gyur pa ste /
translated: all migrating beings are deluded minds.

original: sems 'khrul nas dngos por zhen par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'khrul nas dngos por zhen par gyur pa'o //
translated: The mind is deluded and becomes attached to things.

original: de ni bsam med sus kyang rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: de ni bsam med sus kyang rtogs ma yin //
translated: That is inconceivable and not realized by anyone.

original: zhes pa ni bsam med kyi lhan skyes de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsam med kyi lhan skyes de /
translated: This is the innate non-thought.

original: thabs gang dang bral ba'i gdams ngag gis kyang mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs gang dang bral ba'i gdams ngag gis kyang mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is not realized by the instructions that are devoid of the method.

original: stong pa de 'gro bsam mthong na //
analyzed: stong pa de 'gro bsam mthong na //
translated: When one sees the emptiness of the going of that,

original: rnal 'byor pas ji ltar mthong snyam pa la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ji ltar mthong snyam pa la /
translated: the yogi thinks, “How is it seen?”

original: kye ma zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kye ma zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Kye ma” and so forth are stated.

original: mgo snying lte gsang spangs pa ste //
analyzed: mgo snying lte gsang spangs pa ste //
translated: “The head, heart, navel, and secret place are abandoned.”🔽“I see” is the form of the formless.

original: ngas mthong ste zhes pa ni gzugs med pa'i gzugs te des mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ngas mthong ste zhes pa ni gzugs med pa'i gzugs te des mthong ba'o //
translated: It is also stated:

original: de yang / gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
analyzed: de yang / gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
translated: The formless is the excellent, sublime form,

original: sna tshogs gzugs can yid @277b las skyes //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can yid @277b las skyes // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The form of diversity, born from the mind.

original: stong pa de thabs gang gis mthong bar 'gyur snyam pa la /🔽bsam pas yul ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa de thabs gang gis mthong bar 'gyur snyam pa la / bsam pas yul ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: One thinks, “By what method is that emptiness seen?”🔽“The object is indicated by the thought” and so forth are stated.

original: bsam pa ni mi rtog pa'i bsgom pas yul ni mtshon par byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni mi rtog pa'i bsgom pas yul ni mtshon par byed ces pa'o //
translated: “The thought” is the meditation without discursive thought.

original: yul du snang ba stong pa'i gzugs mtshon par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yul du snang ba stong pa'i gzugs mtshon par byed pa ste /
translated: “The object” is indicated by the empty form that appears as the object.

original: mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is seen.

original: stong gzugs de mi rtog pa'i dbang gis ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: stong gzugs de mi rtog pa'i dbang gis ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: How can that empty form be seen by the power of non-conceptuality?

original: gzhan dag bsam pas rlung 'gag 'gyur //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag bsam pas rlung 'gag 'gyur // zhes smos te /
translated: Others stop the wind by intention.

original: gzhan dag ni mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: Others means non-conceptual.

original: bsam pa ni blo de la gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni blo de la gzhag pa'o //
translated: Intention means placing the mind there.

original: rlung 'gag 'gyur zhes pa ni rlung dbus su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung 'gag 'gyur zhes pa ni rlung dbus su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Stop the wind means the wind enters the center.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
translated: This teaches the following:

original: 'khor ba'i rtsa ba ni rlung yin pas de dbus su zhugs te dag par byas nas gzung 'dzin gyis 'brel pa chad nas stong pa'i gzugs mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rtsa ba ni rlung yin pas de dbus su zhugs te dag par byas nas gzung 'dzin gyis 'brel pa chad nas stong pa'i gzugs mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the root of samsara is the wind, by entering it into the center and purifying it, the connection of subject and object is severed and the empty form is seen.

original: rlung 'gag pa'i thabs de nyid gsal bar bya pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rlung 'gag pa'i thabs de nyid gsal bar bya pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that method of stopping the wind,

original: gal te sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te mi rtog pa'i sems kyis stong pa'i sems mtshon du 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: gal te sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te mi rtog pa'i sems kyis stong pa'i sems mtshon du 'gro ba ni /
translated: it is said, “If the mind,” and so on. The mind of non-conceptuality goes to show the empty mind.

original: mthong ba rgyu des rlung dang / yid ni brtan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba rgyu des rlung dang / yid ni brtan par 'gyur te /
translated: Seeing that, the wind and mind become stable.

original: rang bzhin du thim pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du thim pa'o //
translated: They dissolve into their natural state.

original: yid kyi rtog pa rang bzhin gnyug ma la thim pa'i dpe bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: yid kyi rtog pa rang bzhin gnyug ma la thim pa'i dpe bstan pa ni ;
translated: The example of the dissolution of mental concepts into the intrinsic nature is taught:

original: ji ltar lan tshva tshul zhes pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lan tshva tshul zhes pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: Just like the way of salt.

original: bsam gtan mi dgos na /
analyzed: bsam gtan mi dgos na /
translated: If it is not necessary to meditate,🔽why did the Buddha teach so many meditations?

original: sangs rgyas kyis bsam gtan mang po ci'i phyir bstan snyam pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bsam gtan mang po ci'i phyir bstan snyam pa la /
translated: The answer is:

original: lhan cig la ni lung rnams mang po mthong //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lhan cig la ni lung rnams mang po mthong // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The scriptures see many together.

original: de la lhan cig la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la lhan cig la zhes pa ni /
translated: In this regard, “together”

original: de kho na gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na gcig pa'o //
translated: means the one reality.

original: lung rnams mang po mthong ba ni de kho na nyid brda du ma'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //🔽rang 'dod pa yis so sor snang //
analyzed: lung rnams mang po mthong ba ni de kho na nyid brda du ma'i sgo nas bstan pa'o // rang 'dod pa yis so sor snang //
translated: “The scriptures see many” means that reality is taught by means of many symbols.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: The individual appearances are one’s own desire.

original: dper na sna rtser yungs kar zhes pa lta bu ni rtog pa la dga' ba rnams kyis steng 'og gi sna rtser thig le bsgoms pas mthong la /
analyzed: dper na sna rtser yungs kar zhes pa lta bu ni rtog pa la dga' ba rnams kyis steng 'og gi sna rtser thig le bsgoms pas mthong la /
translated: For example, “at the tip of the nose, mustard seed” means that those who delight in concepts see a drop at the tip of the nose above and below by meditating on it.

original: de kho na nyid la mos pa rnams kyis rlung byang chub sems su mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la mos pa rnams kyis rlung byang chub sems su mthong ba'o //
translated: Those who delight in reality see the vāyu as bodhicitta.

original: des ji ltar mthong ba de ltar mthar thug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des ji ltar mthong ba de ltar mthar thug pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the ultimate is seen just as it is by that.

original: mgon po ni lhan skyes te des sa ra ha gcig po dang mthun gyis /
analyzed: mgon po ni lhan skyes te des sa ra ha gcig po dang mthun gyis /
translated: The Lord is the Innate. He is in agreement with Saraha alone.

original: rtog pa la gnas pa gzhan rnams dang ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: rtog pa la gnas pa gzhan rnams dang ni 'gal lo //
translated: He is in disagreement with others who abide in conceptualization.

original: don la 'gal na de @278a * //
analyzed: don la 'gal na de @278a * //
translated: If there is disagreement with the meaning,🔽then all of them are mistaken.

original: thams cad nor ram snyam na khyim dang zhes smos te /
analyzed: thams cad nor ram snyam na khyim dang zhes smos te /
translated: In response to that, it says “house” and so forth.

original: rang rang gi skal ba dang mthun pa tsam gyis grub mtha' ni ma nor ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang rang gi skal ba dang mthun pa tsam gyis grub mtha' ni ma nor ba nyid do //
translated: The philosophical tenets are not mistaken, merely in accordance with one’s own fortune.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyis ci dang ci bstan pa rnams ni de kho na nyid las brtsams te bstan gyi rtog pa'i bsgom pa las brtsams te ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyis ci dang ci bstan pa rnams ni de kho na nyid las brtsams te bstan gyi rtog pa'i bsgom pa las brtsams te ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, whatever is taught by the Buddha is taught in terms of reality, and not in terms of conceptual meditation.

original: de ni sems de ci bde bar rtogs pas chos thams cad rtog pa'i dpe ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ni sems de ci bde bar rtogs pas chos thams cad rtog pa'i dpe ston pa ni /
translated: That is the teaching of the example of conceptualization of all phenomena through the mind’s own ease.

original: gcig bros pas ni gzhan kun tshim //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gcig bros pas ni gzhan kun tshim // zhes pa ste /
translated: One is satisfied by the satisfaction of all.

original: de la gcig ni rnam shes so //
analyzed: de la gcig ni rnam shes so //
translated: In that regard, “one” is consciousness.

original: zos pas ni bde ba'i ros bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: zos pas ni bde ba'i ros bsgyur ba'o //
translated: “Satisfied” means transformed by the taste of bliss.

original: gzhan kun ni phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan kun ni phung po bzhin no //
translated: “All” means the four aggregates.

original: tshim pa ni bde ba'i ros tshim pa'o //
analyzed: tshim pa ni bde ba'i ros tshim pa'o //
translated: Satisfaction is satisfaction with the taste of bliss.

original: yang na gzhan kun tshig ces pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhan kun tshig ces pa ste /
translated: Or else, all others are burned.

original: dper na shing gcig mes tshig pas 'phros zos nas gzhan nags tshal tshig ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na shing gcig mes tshig pas 'phros zos nas gzhan nags tshal tshig ba bzhin du'o //
translated: For example, just as when one tree is burned by fire, the fire spreads and burns the rest of the forest.

original: lhan skyes de ngo ma shes na btsal bas mi rnyed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lhan skyes de ngo ma shes na btsal bas mi rnyed par bstan pa ni /
translated: The innate is taught not to be found by searching if it is not recognized:

original: phyi rol song nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol song nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having gone outside, the householder searches for it, but does not see it.

original: de la phyi rol song nas zhes pa ni rang la yod pa ngo ma shes par ro //
analyzed: de la phyi rol song nas zhes pa ni rang la yod pa ngo ma shes par ro //
translated: There, “having gone outside” means not recognizing what is present in oneself.

original: khyim bdag ni lhan skyes so //
analyzed: khyim bdag ni lhan skyes so //
translated: The householder is the innate.

original: tshol ba ni btsal bas mi rnyed pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tshol ba ni btsal bas mi rnyed pa zhes pa'o //
translated: “Searching” means not finding it by searching.🔽That is explained:

original: de nyid bshad pas ni 'on kyang ma mthong zhes pa la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pas ni 'on kyang ma mthong zhes pa la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: “But he does not see it.”🔽By whom is it found?

original: gang gis rnyed snyam na rba rlabs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gis rnyed snyam na rba rlabs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Without waves” and so on.

original: rba rlabs med pa ni rtog med do //
analyzed: rba rlabs med pa ni rtog med do //
translated: “Without waves” is nonconceptual.

original: rtog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnyog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnyog pa'o //
translated: “Conceptualization” is the muddiness of suffering.

original: de dang bral ba ni bsam gtan rnam par mi rtog pa'i bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni bsam gtan rnam par mi rtog pa'i bsgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation of non-conceptual concentration is free from that.

original: bsam gtan de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa ni chu dang zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa ni chu dang zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The example of just that concentration is stated with “like water” and so forth.

original: chu dangs pa dang mar me rang gsal ba bzhin du rtog pas ma bslad par zhog ces pa'o //
analyzed: chu dangs pa dang mar me rang gsal ba bzhin du rtog pas ma bslad par zhog ces pa'o //
translated: Like clear water and a self-luminous lamp, one should rest without being polluted by conceptuality.

original: 'gro 'ong nga yis mi len mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'gro 'ong nga yis mi len mi 'dor ro //
translated: “I do not accept or reject coming and going.”

original: zhes pa ni de'i tshe spyod lam gang yang mi dgag par bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i tshe spyod lam gang yang mi dgag par bzhag pa'o //
translated: At that time, any conduct should be left without obstruction.

original: de yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje las //
analyzed: de yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje las //
translated: Moreover, it is said in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: yid kyi dag par mi bya zhing //
analyzed: yid kyi dag par mi bya zhing //
translated: Do not purify the mind.

original: dbang po rnams ni dgag mi bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni dgag mi bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Do not block the senses.
